text: Good movie to watch on a weekend

Rating: 5.6/10

New Moon is a slow, depressing sequel that suffers from the absence of its main star, Edward Cullen.

Highlights
- Faithful Adaptation: The screenplay captures the core theme of Bella's depression and isolation.
- Strong Performances: Taylor Lautner shines as Jacob Black, and Michael Sheen is delightfully campy as Aro.
- Visual Style: Director Chris Weitz brings a new, warmer visual style, and the score is elegant.

Criticisms
- Weak Plot: The story sidelines Edward Cullen, making the central romance grind to a halt.
- Passive Protagonist: Bella becomes a passive, moping character, lacking agency.
- Slow Pacing: The direction is plodding, making the film a slog to watch.

Verdict
New Moon is a commercially successful but critically-panned sequel that faithfully adapts the novel, but is marred by its slow pacing, weak plot, and awkward characters, making it the weakest entry in the saga.

It's long, boring and stupid. If in the first film there was a constant blue filter so you couldn't understand if it was day or night, now there's a new yellow one so it always looks sunny. Also, they killed off the old man that looked like Kung Fu panda. I liked him. Jacob looks like a lesbian mom of 6 with short hair, and also doesn't seem to own a shirt.

I love all the movies in the twilight series! I’ve been obsessed with them since I was a kid and I’m still obsessed with them as an adult!

This is not my favorite book nor movie, but hot damn is it still fun to see in theaters. This movie is light on the Cullen's which I think is the downside. Bella is the worst and Jacob and Edward deserve better. Charlie also deserves a better daughter.

Great story line, awesome cast, and great vibes! This is one of my favorite movies in the Twilight Saga.
Es una pelicula espectacular muy romantica con un buen toque de misterio y suspenso, la pareja protagonica es excelente.

I have read the books now and now I love this movie even more. I think this is the best of the twilight franchise in terms of film and book. If you’re a twilight fan, I believe you would love this movie as much as I loved it when I first watched it, I didn’t like it, but I after reading the books. I liked it.
